page.description: Prefix the following properties with the pointer.Â Use EMAIL.OPEN()to retrieve .

case.title: .CLIENT_HOSTNAME
case.description: The mail server used to send mail (SMTP)

case.title: .CLIENT_IDENTITY
case.description: Your email address

case.title: .CLIENT_PASSWORD
case.description: Your email account password

case.title: .CLIENT_USERNAME
case.description: Your username

case.title: .ERROR
case.description: Contains any error messages reported by the mail server.

case.title: .MAIL_HOSTNAME
case.description: The mail server used to receive mail. (POP)

case.title: .PORT
case.description: The port to use. Generally this can be 0

case.title: .RECEIVE_ATTACHMENTS_FIELD
case.description: The field where attachments are stored. This field will contain the attachment filenames. The actual attachments are in a folder called "Attachments" relative to the table into which email is read.

case.title: .RECEIVE_AUTODELETE
case.description: Controls whether email is deleted from the server when it is read.

case.title: .RECEIVE_BCC_ADDRESS_FIELD
case.description: The field where the Bcc addresses are stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_CC_ADDRESS_FIELD
case.description: The field where the CC addresses are stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_DATE_FIELD
case.description: The field where the email date is stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_FROM_ADDRESS_FIELD
case.description: The field where the address of the sender is stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_LIMIT
case.description: The number of messages Alpha Anywhere should read from the server when the .RECEIVE() method is executed. -1 indicates all messages.

case.title: .RECEIVE_MESSAGE_BODY_FIELD
case.description: The field where the message body is stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_REPLY_FIELD
case.description: The field where the email reply-to address is stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_SUBJECT_FIELD
case.description: The field where the email subject is stored.

case.title: .RECEIVE_TO_FIELD
case.description: The field where the To addresses are stored.

case.title: .SEND_ATTACHMENTS
case.description: The filename of any attachment to be sent with the message.

case.title: .SEND_BCC
case.description: A comma delimited list of BCC addresses to which email is to be sent.

case.title: .SEND_CC
case.description: A comma delimited list of CC addresses to which email is to be sent.

case.title: .SEND_CONTENTS
case.description: The body of the email message.

case.title: .SEND_SUBJECT
case.description: The subject of the email message.

case.title: .SEND_TO
case.description: A comma delimited list of email addresses to which email is to be sent.

case.title: .TEXT_TYPE
case.description: Set to "HTML" for HTML email, or "" (i.e. blank) for regular text email.

case.title: .XMAILER
case.description: The Xmailer field identifies the mailer. It is contained in the message header.
